pageContext.claim: “And, as you heard, your great ambassador and our great ambassador say we've reduced the number to by about 60 percent, which is pretty -- pretty great. Good for both countries, actually. Last year, we reduced the trade deficits of goods between the United States and South Korea by more than 20 percent, and that number is moving very rapidly along.”
pageContext.analysis: It’s not clear what Trump means by “reduced the number by about 60 percent.” Both the goods trade deficit and the services surplus declined — 22.4 percent and 8.3 percent respectively — from 2017 to 2018. That’s 40.8 percent overall decline in the trade deficit with South Korea.
